item.title: Blog post 2
item.description: This is my second attempt at a blog post. summary(iris) ## Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width ## Min. :4.300 Min. :2.000 Min. :1.000 Min. :0.100 ## 1st Qu.:5.100 1st Qu.:2.800 1st Qu.:1.600 1st Qu.:0.300 ## Median :5.800 Median :3.000 Median :4.350 Median :1.300 ## Mean :5.843 Mean :3.057 Mean :3.758 Mean :1.199 ## 3rd Qu.:6.400 3rd Qu.:3.300 3rd Qu.:5.100 3rd Qu.:1.800 ## Max. :7.900 Max. :4.400 Max. :6.900 Max. :2.500 ## Species ## setosa :50 ## versicolor:50 ## virginica :50 ## ## ##

item.title: Population Statistics for Countries from 1990-2017
item.description: fert_dat <- read.csv("children_per_woman_total_fertility.csv") CO2_dat <- read.csv("consumption_emissions_tonnes_per_person.csv") GDP_dat <- read.csv("gdppercapita_us_inflation_adjusted.csv") life_dat <- read.csv("life_expectancy_years.csv") Tidying Data library(tidyr) library(tidyverse) library(dplyr) tidied_fertility <- fert_dat %>% pivot_longer(2:302, names_to = "year", values_to = "fertility") tidied_gdp <- GDP_dat %>% pivot_longer(2:61, names_to = "year", values_to = "GDP_Per_Capita") tidied_Co2 <- CO2_dat %>% pivot_longer(2:29, names_to = "year", values_to = "CO2_emission") tidied_life <- life_dat %>% pivot_longer(2:302, names_to = "year", values_to = "life_expectancy") After uploading and importing datasets that focus on various statistics for countries across the world, these datasets were then “tidied”.

item.title: Population Statistics for Countries from 1990-2017
item.description: fert_dat <- read.csv("/stor/home/cdp2653/children_per_woman_total_fertility.csv") CO2_dat <- read.csv("/stor/home/cdp2653/consumption_emissions_tonnes_per_person.csv") GDP_dat <- read.csv("/stor/home/cdp2653/gdppercapita_us_inflation_adjusted.csv") life_dat <- read.csv("/stor/home/cdp2653/life_expectancy_years.csv") Tidying Data library(tidyr) library(tidyverse) library(dplyr) tidied_fertility <- fert_dat %>% pivot_longer(2:302, names_to = "year", values_to = "fertility") tidied_gdp <- GDP_dat %>% pivot_longer(2:61, names_to = "year", values_to = "GDP_Per_Capita") tidied_Co2 <- CO2_dat %>% pivot_longer(2:29, names_to = "year", values_to = "CO2_emission") tidied_life <- life_dat %>% pivot_longer(2:302, names_to = "year", values_to = "life_expectancy") After uploading and importing datasets that focus on various statistics for countries across the world, these datasets were then “tidied”.
